Stalin was a manipulative Bastard who went from somewhat paranoid to full-blown paraboid. Let's go before Stalin possed all the power, when Lenin was alive. Lenin did not want Stalin to come into power, I forgot what particular reasons, however Stalin manipulated people around Lenin to prevent orders and information that would hurt Stalin from reaching other ears. After Lenin died Stalin would kill off his potential rivals to assume power. He later even killed off his allies over time that supported him to power.
Now there were some positive outcomes that came out of this, such as later when fighting a bloody war against Germany dissent was squashed and treason kept low, allowing a 'harder' response to Germany. Was it worth it, potentially the reason Russia could fight such a war? Up to you to decide, I kinda avoid what-if history.

Here's the subreddit https://www.reddit.com/r/FFRecordKeeper/
The community is fairly helpful, and the community resources are well organized. On top of that it's anniversary is in march so it's a great time to start with all the extra stuff everyone is getting.
One Con it's a gacha game but even if you get the worst weapons and everything it's only a small drop in penalty provided you follow the right strategy and not try to steam roll things later on.
It's fairly generous with giving you 'mirthyl' that you use on the gacha to acquire good gear and weapons. Plus it's guaranteed if you save 50 mirthyl that you will get at least 1 good gear/weapon. However mirthyl is constantly handed out and it's not unreasonable to get 200 mirthyl in one day if you have a lot of spare time, (especially easy if you are just starting out) I average around 8 mirthyl a day but I only spend 10-15 min a day playing.
Oh there's also a multiplayer.

3 reasons I can think of at the moment,
1st volcanoes tend to form near fault lines, volcanic soil is very fertile great for farming, further more mines is a possibility.
2nd fault lines near coastal areas, coastal areas are great in a commercial sense as coastal area's weather is more stable and year round temperatures as well, ports are really good as it's cheaper to move across water. In some cases salt production. And tourism
3rd oil potentially, not sure if it's Due to chance or caused by fault lines but there are quite a few oil reserves near faultlines.
